Clong: A Wrapper for Libclang and a Generator for Clojure APIs

2023/07/23
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

Clong is a powerful tool that serves as a wrapper for libclang and a generator for Clojure APIs. It simplifies the process of creating wrappers for C libraries, making it easier and less error-prone for developers. While it is not designed to be fully automatic, it can handle about 80-90% of the work, providing useful tools for building higher-level APIs.

To use Clong, you can add it as a dependency in your Leiningen or deps.edn project. The com.phronemophobic.clong.clang/parse function is used to parse a header file and pass command line arguments to clang. The most common arguments include -I/my/header/path to specify the header file's path. If you have built clang locally, you may also need to add system paths. The parse function returns a CXCursor, which can be further processed using the raw API in com.phronemophobic.clong.clang.jna.raw.

Clong also offers the capability to generate APIs. You can use the easy-api function to generate a description of the API and then use def-api to generate the required structs, functions, and enums. An example of generating a wrapper for libz is provided in the documentation.

In addition to the examples provided, Clong has been successfully used to generate a complete wrapper for the libav* libraries. This showcases the flexibility and power of Clong in generating complex APIs.

The Clong project is actively maintained and welcomes feedback from the developer community. It is licensed under the Eclipse Public License version 1.0.

Clong is a valuable tool for developers working with C libraries in Clojure. It streamlines the process of creating wrappers and generating APIs, saving time and reducing the chances of errors. By leveraging Clong, developers can focus on building higher-level functionality and delivering robust applications.
